review: I mean, the game's amazing and extremely fun, but the way it's handled is so, so bad. I'll throw in my grain of sand to the mountain.

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ±ÑƒĞ¹Ñ‚Ğµ, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ±ĞµÑĞ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ½Ğ¾.

Overwatch 1 was my most played game over the past 5 years with easily over 1000 hours.
Blizzard deleted half of the game and replaced it with a store.

If you enjoy Overwatch 2 that's fine, but just be aware you are getting an objectively worse version of Overwatch 1 designed to grab as much money as possible for Blizzard.

I've loved playing Overwatch since the beginning. But when Overwatch 2 came out, things changed, and not in a good way. It feels like they don't care about how much time players spend. Doing daily and weekly missions takes up a lot of time, but the rewards aren't worth it. It's disappointing because it seems like the developers care more about money than what players want. This shift has made the game less enjoyable and more like work, and it's not the same as it used to be. the developer just want your money and has no respect of what the players want anymore. Everything you will want in the game you wall have to pay for every week and every month and every season.
